title: More Links For August
summary:
Key ideas
- The man who set the record for fastest drive across the US did it in 28 hours 50 minutes.
- Environmentalist groups are supporting opponents of their cause who are less bad than others from their party.
- People who are richer, whiter, and better educated are less likely to support prizes for participation.
- Marijuana use may not be involved in more fatal accidents in Colorado after legalization.
- Climate geo-engineering is seen as a more attractive solution for reversing some effects of global warming.
- Poverty has no ability to explain criminality rates.
- An analysis of a study showing that "connectedness and sense of purpose" can influence gene expression in positive ways has proved that its statistical methods are flawed.
- Israeli wars may not be aimed at changing things but rather as some sort of tension-release cycle to maintain status quo.

Key learnings
- Supporting opponents of your cause who are less bad than others from their party can serve as an incentive for opposing politicians to moderate their views.
- Personal identity is a concept that needs to be jettisoned.
- Poverty may have no ability to explain criminality rates.
- A critical analysis of a study can reveal flaws in the statistical methods used to find a certain effect.

Key questions
- Why do richer, whiter, and more educated individuals support winner-take-all policies?
- Does poverty have no role in causing criminality rates?
- What is the implication of the flawed statistical methods used in the study that showed that "connectedness and sense of purpose" can impact gene expression?
